product_description: Edible fruit produced by an apple tree and cultivated worldwide. The fruit matures in late summer or autumn, and cultivars exist in a wide range of sizes.
Drupe similar to a small peach from yellow to orange. The flesh is usually succulent and its taste can range from sweet to tart.

Fruit of the avocado tree, cultivated in tropical and Mediterranean climates of many countries. Depending on the variety, avocados have green, brown, purplish, or black skin when ripe, and may be pear-shaped, egg-shaped, or spherical.
Soft and sweet fruit. It is variable in size, color, and firmness, but is usually elongated and curved, with soft flesh rich in starch covered with a rind.
Is a blue or purple fruit that grows wild in fresh areas. They generally have a sweet taste when mature, with variable acidity.
Fruit of many plants of the genus Prunus, and is a fleshy drupe. They come in a variety of colors and flavors.
Fruit of the deciduous woody vines of the flowering plant genus Vitis. They grow in clusters and can be eaten fresh or used for making wine, jam, juice, jelly, vinegar,...

Yellow fruit used for culinary and non-culinary purposes throughout the world, primarily for its juice. The distinctive sour taste of lemon juice makes it a key ingredient in drinks and foods such as lemonade and lemon meringue pie.
Citrus fruit, which is typically round and green in color. Limes are a rich source of vitamin C, are sour, and are often used to accent the flavours of foods and beverages.
Fruit of various citrus species. Common oranges constitute about two-thirds of all the orange production. The majority of this crop is used for juice extraction
Fruits produced and consumed around the world, growing on a tree and harvested in the Northern Hemisphere. Several species of pears are valued for their edible fruit and juices.

Tropical fruit indigenous to South America, where it has been cultivated for many centuries. The flesh and juice of the pineapple are used in cuisines around the world. In many tropical countries, pineapple is prepared and sold on roadsides as a snack.

Red-purple in color, the pomegranate fruit is widely cultivated throughout the Middle East and Caucasus region. Pomegranates are used in baking, cooking, juice blends, meal garnishes, smoothies, and alcoholic beverages.
Red edible fruit of a multitude of plant species grown for the fresh fruit market and for commercial processing in all temperate regions of the world.

Widely appreciated fruit for its characteristic aroma, bright red color, juicy texture, and sweetness. In addition to being consumed fresh, strawberries can be frozen or made into jam or preserves, as well as dried and used in prepared foods, such as cereal bars

Large, medium to dark green fruit grown grown in tropical to temperate climates. The sweet and juicy pulp is usually deep red to pink, with many black seeds, although seedless varieties exist. The fruit can be eaten raw or pickled, and the rind is edible after cooking.
Variety of a species of thistle cultivated as a food. The edible portion of the plant consists of the flower buds before the flowers come into bloom.

Seed of one of several genera of the flowering plant family Fabaceae, which are used as vegetables for human or animal food. They can be cooked in many different ways, including boiling, frying, and baking, and are used in many traditional dishes throughout the world.

Descended from the wild cabbage and belongs to the `cole crops` or brassicas, meaning it is closely related to broccoli and cauliflower. Cabbage is prepared and consumed in many ways. The simplest options include eating the vegetable raw or steaming it, though many cuisines pickle, stew, sautée or braise cabbage.

Root vegetable, typically orange in color, selectively bred for its greatly enlarged and palatable. It contains high quantities of alpha- and beta-carotene, and are a good source of vitamin K and vitamin B6.

White cauliflower is the most common color of cauliflower, having a contrasting white head surrounded by green leaves, and one of hundreds of commercial varieties around the world. Cauliflower heads can be roasted, grilled, boiled, fried, steamed, pickled, or eaten raw.

Widely-cultivated cylindrical fruit used as vegetable, originally from South Asia, with hundreds of varieties. They contain many nutritional benefits, including hydrating properties and valuable nutrients.

Garlic is widely used around the world for its pungent flavor as a seasoning or condiment. Garlic bulbs are normally divided into numerous fleshy sections called cloves. Garlic cloves are used for consumption (raw or cooked) or for medicinal purposes.

Annual plant of the daisy family. It is most often grown as a leaf vegetable, but sometimes for its stem and seeds. Lettuce is most often used for salads, although it is also seen in other kinds of food, such as soups, sandwiches and wraps; it can also be grilled

Widely cultivated vegetable and used around the world. As a food item, they are usually served cooked, as a vegetable or part of a prepared savoury dish, but can also be eaten raw. Onions are commonly chopped and used as an ingredient in various hearty warm dishes, and may also be used as a main ingredient.

Also known as bell pepper or sweet pepper, are fruits in different colors, including red, yellow, orange, green, white, and purple, native to Mexico, Central America, and northern South America. They are commonly used in garden salads and as toppings on pizza or cheesesteaks.
They are starchy tuber native to the Americas and appear in a variety of colors, shapes and sizes. Potatoes are prepared in many ways: skin-on or peeled, whole or cut up, with seasonings or without.

Round vegetable with smooth, slightly ribbed skin, and is most often deep yellow to orange in coloration. Pumpkins are very versatile in their uses for cooking. Most parts of the pumpkin are edible, including the fleshy shell, the seeds, the leaves, and even the flowers.

Edible root vegetable grown and consumed throughout the world, being mostly eaten raw as a crunchy salad vegetable with a pungent flavor. There are numerous varieties, varying in size, flavor, color, and length of time they take to mature.
Red fruit commonly used as a vegetable ingredient or side dish. The tomato is consumed in diverse ways, raw or cooked, in many dishes, sauces, salads, and drinks.
